20.post_text: Nichapat shares her big dreams of starting her own fashion labels one day with us. #ShareHappiness

comments.message: My best NS memories would be always on fridays! Why fridays? Because fridays would be the day for fry oily food and booking out!
No jerry can version with man pack...!
They deploy all girls to cheer the ns guy up hehe good move

Precisely my son had lots of memories to remember wen serving NS army at Tekong. Hes quite obes. So he had to serve 2 n half yrs. My son cant swim n phoebia of heights. He was forced n pushed to swim. But now he was a gd swimmer due to e tidious trainin in e camp. 2ndly. He had to walk on a thin platform wic was quite high. He trembled n cried. After muc trainin n persuasion, not only he can walk he can even run to n fro. He joined army obesity. After 2 n half yrs he was muc bttr. Slim, brave n precisely handsome.
Whole lot knock it down!!!
Happy Birthday Singapore SG50 :)

Anyone about the same batch with me will remember the cook house fire in the middle of the night  at Camp 1 (older) at P Tekong. Next day I think our training was postponed because we have to wait for food from the newer Camp.

And who can forget and "thanks" to the elephant our final road march was cancelled.

It is only during outfield missions in the jungles of Brunei that you see who are the strong ones who will help and motivate each other. Sliding down mud slopes, 4 hour intense rain storms and all manner of insects while crossing a river at night is definitely unforgettable. Being with your buddy is the only thing that makes it bearable.
I was there..wonderin what they do haha..I just passed by then go home :)
every story my favourite nsman Lee Wei Sheng has ever told me of his army days is my fondest memory :)
NS is the best thing to do in my life and I hope to go NS since I was 10 years old.once a gunners always a gunners.i love the word [protect the country with my life].i love army and Happy SG 50
Stand by everything. Bed, Bunk, Toilet, Parade Square etc.
The design is follow old one I know ... But can your put in a screw in cap?
Super Long Weekend.....
It would be nice if it is the glass bottle. I missed those.
When I was in the school of armour the guards on duty at the main gate salute me I was so pei say lah this is the best memory I had in my NS life !

I still can remember the first day in Tekong Cook house , the Ah Beng cook with tattoos shouted ( recruit why never greet me ), he is using the metal scoop to serve rice , veg , meat and soup .
During night snack the coffee filter bag was broken he used his sock to finish the coffee mission. 
Now as a NS men the food was serve by lovely auntie and uncle from SFI

When a NS 4 ton trainer though my son had full arm tattoo, but when he saw my son near his arms are full of hair. Just because my poor son as hairy as bear and always get punished for shadow on his face.
Lost my mag

I was chosen by SCDF and was attached to Clementi Fire Station as a fire fighter during my NS days. Too many great memories to mention here but one of the best was when my team and i fought a residential fire outside a unit at dover in the wee hours. The fire was quite big that it burns the main switch board outside the unit and blackout the entired building. The incident appeared in the papers and there's a pic showing my team and i in action saving some residents.. Now that's a LIFETIME momento!! :)
I bought all 5. I should had bought it at 7-eleven. Cheaper abit

Mine may not be the fondest but the most memorable of my NS life... I was posted to the most famous & notorious Charlie Company at Pulau Tekong... The haunted bunk with the 3rd door!!! On the first day of my report, we were made to assemble in the very bunk with the 3rd door itself where our Company OC told us the full incident in details right in the very bunk... What can be more horrifying than this??!!! Lol
Standing at the parade and command the whole  camp to knock it down and give me twenty
Who can forget the times you chillax with your bunkmates in bunk? Talking and doing rubbish and yet bonding closer to each other

I remembered vividly the most memorable time did the drill with full Police Uniform and stunning shining shoes at the Parade Square for inspection at the Old Police Academy Upper Thomson. Also joined in the Passing Out Day "Talentime with the live Police Combo Band."Awesome mesmerize with Barrack stay in camp duty with other Squad Buddy united.

23.post_text: Celebrate Racial Harmony Day with Coke and the different Coke cans from around the world. #ChooseHappiness

comments.message: Living in a HDB apartment in the West area with 20 years of history, I will never forget running down a corridor of potted plants. I still do, even after 20 years :)
At 20 July got free coke cola at blk 114 Tampines street 11

My parents don't owned a property ourselves. Hence we stay at those Rented room unit above shop house. We shared the toilet and bathroom with the tenants.  My earliest memories of HDB flat is at the age of 6. My whole family of 5 moved to a rented One room Flat HDB at Kim Keat. Although it a rented flat and we all slept in the one bedroom,   we still rejoice as we get to move to a flat with our own toilet and bathroom. We have a bigger space to ourselves.
Bottle too small. Not enough to drink.

Fondest earlier memory- blk 851  YishunSt 81 ... my childhood HDB flat! We play together wif multi racial friends like families! Best of all, my primary school is Naval base primary school ! All my childhood memories in e school, my happiest time all spent at there for 6 yrs!!

My childhood memories of living in HDB flat was way back 30yrs ago in Hougang Ave 10 Blk 415.. Some areas are still under construction but we do have alot of fun.. Playing soccer under the voideck, playing kites , playing hide and seek.. Shops are nearby.. Bustop and other facilities are very good. Now adays when I went back there.. It awfully very quite.. No more kids laughters.. No more chinese uncle or malay uncle sitting under the voideck chit chating.. Old times are the best where we learn to respect each other even if we're from different religion or race.. Miss Old Hougang and my childhood friends..
Y Tampines again sia :(
I remember lots of defects.
Mechelle got limited edition
My earliest memories of the HDB is at Blk 30 Marine Cresent. It is always windy because I'm staying at 11th storey.

It was the Malay Uncle and Auntie that sells ice bag ( sng bao ) at their HDB home. Ice bag is a long plastic bag with two ends tied with rubber bands and it contains sweet iced syrup inside. I remember I used to knock on the slightly opened window and then put my hands inside to pass them a 10 or 20 cents and a sng bag will popped out of the window.  <3

My fondest memories of HDB  were of the big open area at the staircase area of each floor. There was also this U-shaped area (meant as lift lobby but the lift doesn't stop on the 3rd floor which I was stsying on) which me, my siblings and neighbours will use as goal when we play soccer and take penalty shootouts. The area was so spacious we could also play rounders, run and cycle.  The corridors were also one long stretch from one end of the block to another which we used to run or cycle. We also knew every family that stayed on the same floor and those below and above.  It was so much fun and fond childhood memories. #ShareHappiness
Where can buy this limited edition bottle
Nothing beats my first time experience living in a 3-room HDB flat with my parents and brothers at Bukit Ho Swee...
My earliest memory is the one room flat, one long row of units, the doors facing each other and the corridor is super dark even in the day time. :D
Last time all the kids will gather and play police catch thieves  or hide and seek in the hdb blocks.  Now all the kids only know hw to play games on I pads 😂
My fondest childhood memory of running up and down the HDB playing hide and seek.

My fondest memory would be my childhood HDB Flat, 605 Hougang Avenue 4. The fact that I was delivered at home made it extra special. My growing years were spent from infanthood  to P6 (1986-1998)

Amenities were just walking distance:- Hougang Swimming Complex and Stadium, Sports Hall, Hougang polyclinic are all within 300m radius.. 

Then the camaraderie  and friendship built with kids of different races living in the same block or neighbourhoods:- playing in sand Playgrounds, ball games and many others :- block catching, hide and seek, rounders, bmx bicycles (we even came up with a bike group and named ourselves Ghost riders); cycling to neighbouring estates:- punggol, seranggoon, Yio chu Kang..
my early memories is sitting outside my house looking at aeroplane fly pass when i was a small kid
Fan Ng , got coca cola limited edition wor!

My earliest memories of HDB are the people. The whole block is like a kampong. Regardless of which coner or which floor, we know each other. Every time we meet we would say Hi. And whenever i am off to school or back from school I would always meet a group of aunties or ahma sitting at the void deck chatting... Love those days when i was young.
From kampong to HDB was a total different experience for me.  No more leaking zinc roof.  No more dirty toilet.  Is a wonderful feeling.

I remembered many many years back when I was a little girl, every  morning when my mom and I walked past the 4 storey blocks to go to the bus stop, we often see blood everywhere on the floor.   That place Redhill  often got gang flights during the night time.  After the blocks are demolished, the gangsters also went away.   And that place is now my home.     ;)

Childhood as I remember, I could chit chat loudly with my friend whom was staying one storey higher than my house from the laundry room.   Reason was because there were only grills instead of walls, and our laundry rooms faces each other.   Of course we played hide and seek, catch spiders, rolled down the hills and squashes all insects, jumping drains, kicking pong pongs, and dashes all the way down 8 -  10 storeys (lift was too slow back then) when we hear the ice cream man!

Fondest memory - Blk 48 hoy Fatt Road . My childhood HDB flat . Not many know of this road . Back then multi racial neighbors like family . Closely knitted and we look out and take care of each other . Most of the day , our house door and kept open. Best of all , my primary school is just opposite our block named Alexandra Hill Primary School !

24.post_text:
We start implanting our roots when we get our first HDB. It is how we start our family and grow as a community. It is what we can call home and it is what makes us Singaporean. #ShareHappiness Photocred: @Celestekok

What are your earliest memories of the HDB? Tell us and stand to win your own HDB themed Coke Aluminium bottle!

Guess what’s happening on the 20th July, Monday at Blk 114 Tampines street 11 from 5:30pm-8pm? Come and find out! :D
